column4: Hey, is there anyway of finding out what process is hosting on a certain TCP port ?
sure, netstat
netstat --program - if you want the owning program name included
at a guess it's connected to the Hewlett Packard printing daemons
Hmm.. it dosen't make sense. I disabled printer services when I installed ubuntu, to get rid of the open IPP... and I haven't installed anything since last port scanning myself.. it's just appeared
did it get dragged in with an update?
maybe an 'aptitude search hplip' ?
Ah. thanks. Think this will be as easy as removing a package ?
an 'i' at the start of a line means that package is installed
that just searches for it, you can tell if it's installed from there - after that, remove it like you normally would if it's there
Ahhhh, Thanks a bunch. The package you mentioned is installed
np's :)
Oh, not so good...
warning you about removing ubuntu-desktop?
When I mark it for removal in synaptic, -- yeah
don't worry, so long as it's just ubuntu-desktop, that's only a metapackage, no actual programs or data in it
Ahhh, alright
Removing...
it'll stop the daemon, but 'ps -ef | grep hpiod' to be sure
Yah. Just stopped it. You're too good at this :P. Thanks lots
np's again - have fun
Cheers, take care :)
